node.title: How to output functor material properties
node.bodyText:
Hello:
I use an AuxVariable and the ADFunctorElementalAux to get the value of a material property.  For example:
[rho_out]
    type = ADFunctorElementalAux
    functor = 'rho_gas'
    variable = 'rho_var'
    execute_on = 'timestep_end'
  []

However, both in a VPP and in the Exodus file, the values of rho_var correspond to that for the last element in my mesh.  Values for the other elements don't show up.  Is there some way to do this?
Thanks,
Joe Kelly

@joe61vette can you show me your block for your rho_var aux variable? My suspicion is that you are creating a nodal aux variable, in which case you will be evaluating a nodal aux kernel ... and we use _current_elem in the FunctorElementalAux evaluation which will be wrong if the aux kernel is being evaluated as a nodal quantity. We will add an error check to FunctorElementalAux that will catch this in the future

I bet you're right.  Here it is:
[rho_var]
[]
It was copied from the NS test case functorfluidprops.i

Please change it to
[rho_var]
  type = MooseVariableFVReal
[]

that test will be modified. The exodus seems fine because all the variables are constant over the domain in that test
THANKS Alex & Guillaume.

node.title: Ensuring normalisation at all times of multiple components (variables)
node.bodyText:
Hi all,
I wish to ensure the quadratic sum of multiple variables (representing vector components) equals 1 at all times during the simulation. I need this normalisation to be compatible with seperate evolution with free energy functionals with the Phase Field module. Thank you for your time and help.
Thanks,
Robert
@lindsayad I m thinking he should work with a lagrange multiplier scalar variable to enforce the constraint. Can you think of alternatives?
I agree

Thank you both for your responses. But doesn't the ScalarLagrangeConstraint only work with the variables themselves and not functions of them? As I need mine to work with their quadratic sum, thanks again

Hello
There may not be an object that does exactly what you want already. You will likely have to build it off of existing objects.
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/kernels/ScalarLagrangeMultiplier.html is almost what you want, you just need to change the implementation of the norm to the one you want.
Guillaume
actually you ll need to adapt it to array variables as well, since it's only looking at a single variable.

What vector does this represent?
We have done this for magnetization successfully using a longitudinal term in the PDE. Perhaps something similar can work for you. I suppose it depends on what equation governs your vector component variables
Another alternative is letting your vector live on the unit sphere and reformulate your PDE in terms of angles. If the PDE isn't too horrible, it would work and you get the added bonus of having one less variable and significantly less dof when you scale.

node.title: Error on implementing periodic boundary condition
node.bodyText:
Hello MOOSE Experts
I am working with a chemo-mechanical model in which displacement is diffusion induced.
For the sake of RVE, I want to implement periodic boundary conditions on the displacement field.
My domain is of square shape with coordinates (0,0), (1e-5,0), (1e-5,1e-5) and (0,1e-5). I have generated the mesh in cubit and also verified the domain size using paraview.
I am trying to put periodic boundary conditions on disp_x and disp_y for the left and right boundaries. But I am getting the following error:
*** ERROR ***
Periodic boundary neighbor not found

application called MPI_Abort(MPI_COMM_WORLD, 1) - process 3


*** ERROR ***
Periodic boundary neighbor not found

My code snippet for implementing periodic bc is as follows:
[./Periodic]
    [./left_right_periodic_disp_x]
      variable = disp_x
      primary = left1
      secondary = right1
      translation = '1e-05 0 0'
    [../]
    [./left_right_periodic_disp_y]
      variable = disp_y
      primary = left1
      secondary = right1
      translation = '1e-05 0 0'
    [../]
  [../]

Please let me know any suggestions you have?
Update: If I apply the periodic boundaries on top and bottom boundaries, I didn't get any error even if put the wrong translation value.
Thanks.
Best
Avtar

Dear @asingh-mit
Since your domain is a square,
you can try with auto_direction
For instrance, see this one:
https://github.com/ngrilli/c_pfor_am/blob/main/test/tests/SandfeldZaiser2015/SandfeldLoop.i
Best Regards,
Nicolò

Hey @ngrilli
Thank you very much. But I am importing a mesh file not generating it using a mesh generator. It cannot be used in that scenario.
Please correct me if I am wrong.
Even though I have tried and get the following error.
*** ERROR ***
Task init_mesh is not registered to build MeshGenerator derived objects

Best
Avtar

You can import the mesh using the FileMeshGenerator.
Then you can use mesh generators to modify it.
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/meshgenerators/FileMeshGenerator.html

Hi @GiudGiud
Thank you very much.
I am trying a simple problem. I have a square domain of size 1x1 afterward I am scaling the mesh. In this simple problem, the periodic boundary condition is not working. Please let me know any issues with the input file.
[Mesh]
   [./initial_mesh]
     type =FileMeshGenerator
     file = 'sq1.e'
  []

  [./scale]
    type = TransformGenerator
    input = initial_mesh
    transform = SCALE
    vector_value ='40 40 0'
  []
[]

[Variables]
  [./u]
    order = FIRST
    family = LAGRANGE
  [../]
[]

[Kernels]
  [./diff]
    type = Diffusion
    variable = u
  [../]

  [./dot]
    type = TimeDerivative
    variable = u
  [../]

[]

[BCs]
  [./u_left]
    type = DirichletBC
    variable = u
    boundary = left1
    value = 1
  [../]

  [./Periodic]
    [./x_direction]
      variable = u
      primary = left1
      secondary = right1
      translation = '40 0 0'
    [../]
  [../]
[]

[Executioner]
  type = Transient
  dt = 1
  num_steps = 20
  solve_type = NEWTON
[]

[Outputs]
  execute_on = 'timestep_end'
  file_base = out
  exodus = true
[]

Best
Avtar
u has both a Dirichlet and a periodic BC on left1? Might as well just use two DirichletBCs

@GiudGiud
This is just a simple example problem I am trying to solve. Let's say with the Dirichlet BC, the value enforced on left should be transferred to the right using periodic boundary conditions.
Left and right boundaries get similar values if I use moose inbuilt MESHGENERATOR rather than the file.
Update: I have even tried the EqualConstraint options but nothing is working for me.
Best
Avtar
Is there any way, so that I can use the auto direction option for periodic boundary conditions while still importing the mesh file?

I highly doubt we support that. Please use a single boundary conditions per boundary per variable first, and see if you can make that work for your cases.
PeriodicBCs are a whole different beast than DirichletBC. They are pretty much directly interfacing with libmesh to modify the numerical system.
But you are saying it works with moose generated meshes? Just not your custom one?

Yes, It is working with the MOOSE-generated meshes.
Actually, I am working on a chemo-mechanical problem in which displacement is induced. In that case, I only want to apply periodic boundary conditions for displacements on left, right, top, and bottom sides. No Dirichlet boundary conditions are needed. I tried to implement PeriodicBC there but it was not working so I am trying to implement it for the much simpler problem.
Best
Avtar
Looks like your imported mesh has boundaries where the nodes do not exactly line up. Easiest solution is to remesh, or use an integrated constraint to enforce periodicity.

Thank you very much @dschwen. I will try the suggestions you proposed. Actually, I am using the scaling option in CUBIT to scale the model. I think that is distorting the mesh somehow.
Best
Avtar

Hello @GiudGiud and @dschwen
Thank you very much for your valuable insights and help. I resolved the issue.
Actually, periodic boundary conditions can only be applied to SIDESETS.
I was trying to implement it to NODESETS.
This has not been documented in the given text:
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/actions/AddPeriodicBCAction.html
Best
Avtar

Hello
There should be another documentation page for periodic boundary conditions, this is the "Action" page. I cant find it so it may not exist.
Thanks for reporting this i ll add it to an upcoming documentation PR
Guillaume
Is this conclusion correct?? I'm a little surprised by that.

Well I double checked the missing docs and I didnt find a better page than the Action. It's not explicitly specified what's supported in that page either.
wrt to nodesets and sidesets, what kind of variable are you using?

note that you can get sidesets from nodesets and vice-versa from MOOSE. See this page:
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/mesh/MooseMesh.html
OP was using PBC on a nodal variable.
I mean, if PBC on a node set doesn't work for a nodal variable, that sounds like a bug -- not something that should be documented.

Hello @hugary1995 and @GiudGiud
I generated the mesh using Trelis. It's a simple square domain.
First, I generated the nodesets and tried to apply the PBC, it was not working.
Input file, I was using is as below:
[Mesh]
   [./initial_mesh]
     type =FileMeshGenerator
     file = 'sq1.e'
  []

  [./scale]
    type = TransformGenerator
    input = initial_mesh
    transform = SCALE
    vector_value ='40 40 0'
  []
[]

[Variables]
  [./u]
    order = FIRST
    family = LAGRANGE
  [../]
[]

[Kernels]
  [./diff]
    type = Diffusion
    variable = u
  [../]

  [./dot]
    type = TimeDerivative
    variable = u
  [../]

[]

[BCs]
  [./u_left]
    type = DirichletBC
    variable = u
    boundary = left1
    value = 1
  [../]

  [./Periodic]
    [./x_direction]
      variable = u
      primary = left1
      secondary = right1
      translation = '40 0 0'
    [../]
  [../]
[]

[Executioner]
  type = Transient
  dt = 1
  num_steps = 20
  solve_type = NEWTON
[]

[Outputs]
  execute_on = 'timestep_end'
  file_base = out
  exodus = true
[]

I am using this file, just to understand the working of PBCs.
After struggling for 3 days. I generated the side sets in TRELIS and tried to apply the PBC, and then it started working absolutely fine.
Afterward, I applied the PBC on the displacement field in my actual chemo-mechanical problem, and they started working nicely.
Best
Avtar

It's not just a PBC, it's trying to get the DirichletBC applied on one side to be transported to the other side by the PBC.
If nodal PBCs were broken I think we would know about it

node.title: native windows build exe
node.bodyText:
I noted currently the instruction for windows installation is using conda and WSL, is there any way to get windows native builds (exe file) through cygwin or mingw?
Only the core server modulue is needed, post processing module is not necessary.

Hello
No we have not developed a windows native build. We are interested in having this though, if anyone wants to tackle it
Guillaume
We have tried our hand on a native Windows build before. This effort might get revived as there is a libmesh contributor who's working on native support for VC.

node.title: Spatial condition on DirichletBC function
node.bodyText:
Hi everyone,
I recently started using MOOSE to do some elastic deformation. I would like to prescribe a short (in time) and localized (in space) change in the Dirichlet boundary condition on one of the sides of my domain. I used inline functions before to add temporal and spatial constraints to constant boundary conditions. A generic example:
[BCs]
  [BC_1]
     type = FunctionDirichletBC
      variable = my_variable
      boundary = 'my_boundary'
      function = 'if( (x>1.) & (x<2.) & (t>1.), 1., 0.)'
  []
[]

But now I have a forcing with values through time stored in a file that I load with a function:
[Functions]
  [forcing]
    type = PiecewiseLinear
    data_file = my_forcing.csv
    scale_factor = 1.0
    format = 'columns'
  []
[]

And would like to apply it when specific spatial conditions are met. I initially thought the following could maybe be possible in BC_1:
function = 'if( (x>1.) & (x<2.), forcing, 0) or function = 'if( (x>1.) & (x<2.), forcing(t), 0) but this is not the case.
All the input files are very useful and helped me a lot to setup my app but in this case I am struggling a bit to find the right strategy.
Maybe the/a proper way to do it would be to, at the mesh generation step, give a different  blockID to the elements where I want to prescribe this forcing and then use block ids in the input file?
Any help would be much appreciated! Thank you a lot in advance!
P.S. I've been enjoying MOOSE a lot so far, being a Libmesh user this is making everything much easier and more efficient! Thank you a lot for all your work! 👍

So I think I found a solution: generate a new side set with a given id that I can then use in the different objects. Just like here:
(see @GiudGiud's comment below with the different possible options!)

  
    
      moose/test/tests/mesh_modifiers/add_side_sets_from_bounding_box/multiple_boundary_ids_3d.i
    
    
        Lines 19 to 26
      in
      06bc1f7
    
  
  
    

        
          
           [createNewSidesetTwo] 
        

        
          
             type = SideSetsFromBoundingBoxGenerator 
        

        
          
             input = createNewSidesetOne 
        

        
          
             block_id = 0 
        

        
          
             boundary_id_old = 'right top back' 
        

        
          
             boundary_id_new = 11 
        

        
          
             bottom_left = '0.6 0.7 0.8' 
        

        
          
             top_right = '1.1 1.1 1.1' 
        
    
  


However I'm still interesting to see if you think it's a good/the best solution?

For the space restriction, this is a good idea. Then do the time restriction with a function.
The best solution would be a ParsedDirichletBC (similar to ParsedAux or ParsedPostprocessor) in my opinion. We havent developed that one yet.
Thank you a lot for your answer!

For the time restriction, I'm not sure how to proceed since I already have a forcing function (hence a variable forcing with time). Like in my post but with x being time:

And would like to apply it when specific spatial conditions are met. I initially thought the following could maybe be possible in BC_1:
function = 'if( (x>1.) & (x<2.), forcing, 0) or function = 'if( (x>1.) & (x<2.), forcing(t), 0) but this is not the case.

x is time?
So the condition (in fake code) is:
if( (t>1.) & (t<2.), forcing(t), 0)  ?
Yes! That was my initial idea.

A few options:


add a scaling factor argument (currently does not exist) to the FunctionDirichletBC https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/bcs/FunctionDirichletBC.html
(This has a scale_factor in the code if you want an example: https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/functions/CompositeFunction.html)
then use the Control system to modify it with the step function : https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/controls/RealFunctionControl.html


use the RealFunctionContrl https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/controls/RealFunctionControl.html directly with the Function to control a DirichletBC
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/bcs/DirichletBC.html


Make your own DirichletBC that loads the CSV and uses it, so merge PieceWiseLinear and DirichletBC for your app.


Use a https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/functions/CompositeFunction.html with a step function multiplier, for the FunctionDirichletBC


2 and 4 are no-code

Thank you a lot for all those options! At the end I decided to have the temporal conditions directly prescribed in my forcing csv file as they might get quite complicated at some point, and would result in very long temporal conditions. But I will for sure need the options you just listed in a short moment!
In parallel, more than controlling the value associated with a given DirichletBC, I would like to completely enable/disable a Dirichlet BC at given times (in my case, releasing the boundary over a short period of time). And for that I think I am really stuck now. Again, any tips would be much appreciated!
Thank you a lot for your help!

In parallel, more than controlling the value associated with a given DirichletBC, I would like to completely enable/disable a Dirichlet BC  > at given times (in my case, releasing the boundary over a short period of time).

I think the controls system is the/a way to go (as used e.g. here #20208). Do you agree?
Thank you a lot for your help!

Control system is the way to go here. Should work fine on a DirichletBC
…
 Le 11 févr. 2022 à 07:26, Adrien Wehrlé ***@***.***> a écrit :

 ﻿
 In parallel, more than controlling the value associated with a given DirichletBC, I would like to completely enable/disable a Dirichlet BC > at given times (in my case, releasing the boundary over a short period of time).

 I think the controls system is the/a way to go (as used e.g. here #20208). Do you agree?

 —
 Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or unsubscribe.
 Triage notifications on the go with GitHub Mobile for iOS or Android.
 You are receiving this because you commented.
Thank you a lot!

node.title: Undefined symbols for architecture arm64 linking libmoose-opt.la

node.bodyText: FYI to those who come across this thread later - Discussions can be converted to issues (and vice versa), without needing to redo or copy anything over. @Jacobfaib I will put a response in #20276

node.title: Three Network material model PolyUMod
node.bodyText:
Hello,
Is it possible to import Three Network material model from PolyUMod to Moose? Or can I implement the Three Network model directly in Moose?
Thanks,
Tatiana
@jiangwen84 @hugary1995  do you know about this PolyUMod?
I doubt it can be directly imported to MOOSE, but you should be able to implement in MOOSE's TensorMechanics module. You can consider to use this new Lagrangian Mechanics staff, see #17475

node.title: How to create random circles in a specific region
node.bodyText:
Hello!
I am currently using "MultiSmoothCircleIC" to create circles in my generated mesh. Once I increase the size of my mesh domain and create a smaller subdomain with "SubdomainBoundingBoxGenerator" where I want the circles to be generated, the "MultiSmoothCircleIC" keeps generating the circles outside of the subdomain. Is there a way to generate random circles within a specified region? Or is it better to just use "SpecifiedSmoothCircleIC"?
Thanks!
You have to block restrict your initial condition to generate circles within the subdomain. Try specifying block=#subdomain_id in your initial condition.

I am trying to import a mesh file generated by iso2mesh open-source package. This package basically takes the stack file generated from the series of 2d images and gives the tetrahedral mesh model or data.
However, when I am importing the file, the following error appears:
  Elem Information

I have tried the refined mesh but still, the error is there.
Please let me know any suggestions.
Also, Is there any possibility that MOOSE can generate the mesh from the stack of 2d images?
Best
Avtar

Also, Is there any possibility that MOOSE can generate the mesh from the stack of 2d images?

You can try  ImageFunction.
I have tried but it's not working for me. I have a number of grains in the geometry. Imagefunction is failing.

Hello
Seems like several elements are inverted.
What is the output of iso2mesh? Can you fix the mesh from there?
Guillaume

Hello
Output from the ISO2MESH is nodes, connectivity, and faces. They have some inbuilt functions for Abaqus file output. I am using that to get the Abaqus file and importing that to MOOSE.
I have tried the MESHQUALITY and CELLSIZE filter in the PARAVIEW and didn't get the -ve volume for any of the mesh elements.
Any other suggestions?
UPDATE:
I tried to open the abaqus file given by iso2mesh in ABAQUS. Its something like shown in the image.

is this supposed to be a 2D mesh or a 3D mesh?
If 3D, how is this generated from a 2D image?

node.title: Outputting Total Gibbs Free Energy in Phase Field Simulations
node.bodyText:
Dear MOOSE Comunity
I am working with the martensite transformation test input deck which I have modified as per the requirements but I wish to get the values of gibbs energy at each time step so that II can verify my simulation from the results in the literature.Any headers in this regard will prove beneficial.
Many Thanks
Pushkar
Check this TotalFreeEnergy. More options are available on AuxKernels System page.
Thanks @ykvishal for directing to the relevent webpage
